snippet: They continued to take and give offence with aslittle hesitation as before the legislative dispersionwhich had been attempted; as appears from the preamble to statute 1633, chapter 30, setting forth thatthe clan Gregor, which had been suppressed and reduced to quietness by the great care of the late KingJames of eternal memory, had nevertheless brokenout again, in the counties of Perth, Stirling, Clackmannan, Monteith, Lennox, Angus, and Mearns; forwhich reason the statute re-establishes the disabilitiesattached to the clan, and grants a new commissionfor enforcing the laws against that wicked and rebellious race.
